## 3.6.3 Soft Delete Estrat√©gico (Sem NULLs!)

Sua abordagem √© correta: soft delete **n√£o deve deixar dados √≥rf√£os**.

### O Problema com Soft Delete Tradicional

```python
# ‚ùå Soft delete ing√™nuo que deixa NULL
def soft_delete_team(team_id):
    team = db.get(Team, team_id)
    team.deleted_at = datetime.now()

    # E os membros? Ficam apontando para um time "deletado"
    # E os projetos? Ficam com team_id de um time que n√£o existe mais
```

### Sua Abordagem: Inativa√ß√£o Controlada

```python
# ‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê
# ESTRAT√âGIA: INATIVAR, N√ÉO APAGAR
# ‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê

class Status(PyEnum):
    ATIVO = "ativo"
    INATIVO = "inativo"      # Cadastro desativado temporariamente
    SUSPENSO = "suspenso"    # Cadastro suspenso por algum motivo
    BLOQUEADO = "bloqueado"  # Cadastro bloqueado por viola√ß√£o
    EXCLUIDO = "excluido"    # Soft delete - para auditoria

# Base com campos de auditoria COMPLETOS
class Base(MappedAsDataclass, DeclarativeBase):
    __abstract__ = True

    id: Mapped[int] = mapped_column(Integer, primary_key=True, init=False)
    created_at: Mapped[datetime] = mapped_column(DateTime, server_default=func.now(), init=False)
    updated_at: Mapped[datetime] = mapped_column(DateTime, server_default=func.now(), onupdate=func.now(), init=False)

    # Auditoria de cria√ß√£o/atualiza√ß√£o
    created_by: Mapped[int | None] = mapped_column(Integer, nullable=True, init=False)
    updated_by: Mapped[int | None] = mapped_column(Integer, nullable=True, init=False)

    # Soft delete com auditoria
    deleted_at: Mapped[datetime | None] = mapped_column(DateTime, nullable=True, init=False)
    deleted_by: Mapped[int | None] = mapped_column(Integer, nullable=True, init=False)

    # Status que controla o comportamento
    active: Mapped[Status] = mapped_column(Enum(Status), default=Status.ATIVO, init=False)
```

### Regras de Neg√≥cio para Delete

```python
# ‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê
# services/team_service.py
# ‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê

class TeamService:
    def delete_team(self, db: Session, team_id: int, deleted_by: int) -> None:
        """
        Soft delete de time.

        REGRAS:
        1. Time n√£o pode ser deletado se tiver MEMBROS ATIVOS
        2. Time n√£o pode ser deletado se tiver PROJETOS EM ANDAMENTO
        3. Registros hist√≥ricos (projetos encerrados) permanecem intactos
        """
        team = self.repository.get_by_id_with_relations(db, team_id)
        if not team:
            raise TeamNotFoundError(f"Time {team_id} n√£o encontrado")

        # Verificar membros ativos
        active_members = [m for m in team.team_members if m.active == Status.ATIVO]
        if active_members:
            raise TeamHasActiveMembersError(
                f"Time tem {len(active_members)} membros ativos. "
                "Transfira os membros para outro time antes de deletar."
            )

        # Verificar projetos em andamento
        active_projects = [
            p for p in team.team_projects
            if p.project_status not in [ProjectStatus.ENCERRADO, ProjectStatus.CANCELADO]
        ]
        if active_projects:
            raise TeamHasActiveProjectsError(
                f"Time tem {len(active_projects)} projetos em andamento. "
                "Finalize ou transfira os projetos antes de deletar."
            )

        # Soft delete
        self.repository.soft_delete(db, team, deleted_by)
```

### Queries que Respeitam Soft Delete

```python
# ‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê
# infra/repositories/team_repository.py
# ‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê

class TeamRepository:
    def get_all_active(self, db: Session) -> list[Team]:
        """Lista APENAS times ativos (padr√£o para uso normal)."""
        stmt = select(Team).where(Team.active == Status.ATIVO)
        return list(db.scalars(stmt).all())

    def get_all_including_deleted(self, db: Session) -> list[Team]:
        """Lista TODOS os times (para auditoria/admin)."""
        return list(db.scalars(select(Team)).all())

    def get_by_id_active(self, db: Session, team_id: int) -> Team | None:
        """Busca time ativo por ID."""
        stmt = select(Team).where(
            Team.id == team_id,
            Team.active == Status.ATIVO
        )
        return db.scalars(stmt).first()

    def get_deleted_between(
        self,
        db: Session,
        start_date: datetime,
        end_date: datetime
    ) -> list[Team]:
        """Relat√≥rio de times deletados em um per√≠odo (auditoria)."""
        stmt = select(Team).where(
            Team.deleted_at.between(start_date, end_date)
        )
        return list(db.scalars(stmt).all())
```

### Reativa√ß√£o de Cadastro

```python
# ‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê
# Permite recadastramento/reativa√ß√£o
# ‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê

class TeamService:
    def reactivate_team(self, db: Session, team_id: int, reactivated_by: int) -> TeamResponse:
        """
        Reativa um time que foi soft deleted.

        √ötil para:
        - Corre√ß√£o de dele√ß√£o acidental
        - Reativa√ß√£o de equipes sazonais
        - Recupera√ß√£o de dados
        """
        team = self.repository.get_by_id(db, team_id)  # Busca mesmo deletados
        if not team:
            raise TeamNotFoundError(f"Time {team_id} n√£o encontrado")

        if team.active == Status.ATIVO:
            raise TeamAlreadyActiveError("Time j√° est√° ativo")

        # Reativar
        team.active = Status.ATIVO
        team.deleted_at = None
        team.deleted_by = None
        team.updated_by = reactivated_by

        db.flush()
        db.refresh(team)

        return TeamResponse.model_validate(team)
```

### Resumo: Seu Soft Delete

| Aspecto | Abordagem |
|---------|-----------|
| **O que acontece no DELETE** | Status muda para EXCLUIDO |
| **Dados s√£o apagados?** | N√ÉO, nunca |
| **FKs ficam NULL?** | N√ÉO, integridade mantida |
| **Pode recadastrar?** | SIM, reativar o registro |
| **Auditoria** | deleted_at + deleted_by sempre preenchidos |
| **Performance** | √çndice em `active` para queries |
| **Hist√≥rico** | 100% preservado |

## 3.7 Refer√™ncia: Services - Camada de Neg√≥cio em Detalhe

### Arquitetura em Camadas

```
‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
‚îÇ   API Layer (FastAPI)               ‚îÇ  ‚Üê Endpoints HTTP
‚îÇ   - Valida√ß√£o de input              ‚îÇ
‚îÇ   - Serializa√ß√£o de output          ‚îÇ
‚îÇ   - HTTP status codes               ‚îÇ

              ‚îÇ
‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚ñº‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê

‚îÇ   - Regras de neg√≥cio               ‚îÇ
```

### Repository (Acesso a Dados)

```python
# infra/repositories/user_repository.py
from sqlalchemy.orm import Session
from infra.entities.user import User

class UserRepository:
    """Opera√ß√µes de acesso a dados (CRUD)"""

    def __init__(self, db: Session):
        self.db = db

    def get_by_id(self, user_id: int) -> User | None:
        """Busca user por ID"""
        return self.db.get(User, user_id)

    def get_by_email(self, email: str) -> User | None:
        """Busca user por email"""
        return (
            self.db.query(User)
            .filter(User.user_email == email)
            .filter(User.deleted_at.is_(None))
            .first()
        )

    def list_active(self, limit: int = 100, offset: int = 0) -> list[User]:
        """Lista users ativos"""
        return (
            self.db.query(User)
            .filter(User.deleted_at.is_(None))
            .filter(User.is_active == True)
            .limit(limit)
            .offset(offset)
            .all()
        )

    def create(self, user: User) -> User:
        """Cria user"""
        self.db.add(user)
        self.db.flush()  # Flush sem commit (deixa pra service)
        return user

    def update(self, user: User) -> User:
        """Atualiza user"""
        self.db.flush()
        return user

    def delete(self, user: User):
        """Delete f√≠sico"""
        self.db.delete(user)
        self.db.flush()
```

### BaseRepository - Padr√£o Gen√©rico (Do B√°sico ao Estado da Arte)

O c√≥digo acima funciona, mas tem um problema: **voc√™ vai repetir o mesmo c√≥digo em TODOS os reposit√≥rios**. CRUD √© sempre igual: `get_by_id`, `create`, `update`, `delete`. A solu√ß√£o √© criar uma **classe base gen√©rica** que todos herdam.

#### N√≠vel 1: Entendendo o Problema (B√ÅSICO)

Sem BaseRepository, voc√™ tem duplica√ß√£o massiva:

```python
# user_repository.py
class UserRepository:
    def __init__(self, db: Session):
        self.db = db

    def get_by_id(self, id: int) -> User | None:
        return self.db.get(User, id)

    def create(self, user: User) -> User:
        self.db.add(user)
        self.db.flush()
        return user

# team_repository.py - MESMO C√ìDIGO!
class TeamRepository:
    def __init__(self, db: Session):
        self.db = db

    def get_by_id(self, id: int) -> Team | None:
        return self.db.get(Team, id)

    def create(self, team: Team) -> Team:
        self.db.add(team)
        self.db.flush()
        return team

# ticket_repository.py - MESMO C√ìDIGO!
# project_repository.py - MESMO C√ìDIGO!
# ... 10 reposit√≥rios com c√≥digo id√™ntico
```

**Problemas**:
- Viola√ß√£o do DRY (Don't Repeat Yourself)
- Bug em um lugar = bug em todos (ou esquece de arrumar em alguns)
- Manuten√ß√£o imposs√≠vel

---

#### N√≠vel 2: Entendendo Generic e TypeVar (INTERMEDI√ÅRIO)

Para criar uma classe base, precisamos de **Generic** - um recurso do Python que permite criar classes que funcionam com "qualquer tipo".

**O que √© TypeVar?**

```python
from typing import TypeVar

# Cria uma "vari√°vel de tipo" chamada T
T = TypeVar("T")

# T pode ser qualquer coisa: int, str, User, Team...
def primeiro_elemento(lista: list[T]) -> T:
    return lista[0]

# Python infere o tipo automaticamente:
numeros = [1, 2, 3]
resultado = primeiro_elemento(numeros)  # resultado √© int

nomes = ["Ana", "Bob"]
resultado = primeiro_elemento(nomes)    # resultado √© str
```

**O que √© bound?**

`bound` restringe T para ser uma classe espec√≠fica ou subclasse dela:

```python
from typing import TypeVar
from infra.configs.database import Base

# T DEVE ser subclasse de Base (User, Team, Ticket...)
T = TypeVar("T", bound=Base)

# Isso garante que T sempre ter√° os atributos de Base:
# - id
# - active
# - created_at
# - deleted_at
# etc.
```

**O que √© Generic?**

`Generic[T]` permite que uma classe seja parametrizada por um tipo:

```python
from typing import Generic, TypeVar

T = TypeVar("T")

class Caixa(Generic[T]):
    def __init__(self, conteudo: T):
        self.conteudo = conteudo

    def abrir(self) -> T:
        return self.conteudo

# Uso:
caixa_int = Caixa[int](42)          # T = int
valor = caixa_int.abrir()            # valor √© int

caixa_str = Caixa[str]("presente")  # T = str
texto = caixa_str.abrir()            # texto √© str
```

---

#### N√≠vel 3: Criando BaseRepository (AVAN√áADO)

Agora que entendemos Generic e TypeVar, vamos criar o BaseRepository:

```python
# infra/repositories/base_repository.py
"""
Reposit√≥rio base com opera√ß√µes CRUD e suporte a soft delete.

Por que usar BaseRepository?
1. DRY: N√£o repete c√≥digo CRUD em cada reposit√≥rio
2. Consist√™ncia: Todos os reposit√≥rios funcionam igual
3. Soft Delete: Autom√°tico em todas as entidades
4. Manuten√ß√£o: Corrige uma vez, corrige em todos
"""
from datetime import datetime
from typing import TypeVar, Generic, Type, List, Optional

from sqlalchemy.orm import Session

from infra.configs.connection import DBConnectionHandler
from infra.configs.database import Base, Status

# T √© restrito a subclasses de Base
# Isso garante que T sempre ter√°: id, active, deleted_at, etc.
T = TypeVar("T", bound=Base)


class BaseRepository(Generic[T]):
    """
    Reposit√≥rio base gen√©rico com CRUD e soft delete.

    Generic[T] significa: "Esta classe trabalha com um tipo T"
    Quando voc√™ herda: class UserRepository(BaseRepository[User])
    O Python substitui T por User automaticamente.
    """

    def __init__(self, model: Type[T]):
        """
        Args:
            model: A classe da entidade (User, Team, Ticket, etc.)

        Type[T] significa: "o tipo T em si, n√£o uma inst√¢ncia de T"
        - T = User (uma inst√¢ncia)
        - Type[T] = classe User (a classe em si)
        """
        self.model = model
```

**Entendendo `Type[T]` vs `T`**:

```python
# T = uma inst√¢ncia do tipo
user: User = User(name="Jo√£o")  # user √© uma inst√¢ncia

# Type[T] = a classe em si
model: Type[User] = User        # model √© a classe User

# No repository:
def get_by_id(self, id: int) -> T:
    # self.model √© Type[T] (a classe)
    # O retorno √© T (uma inst√¢ncia)
    return self.db.query(self.model).get(id)
```

#### N√≠vel 4: BaseRepository Completo (ESTADO DA ARTE)

O c√≥digo completo com todas as opera√ß√µes:

```python
# infra/repositories/base_repository.py
from datetime import datetime
from typing import TypeVar, Generic, Type, List, Optional

from sqlalchemy.orm import Session

from infra.configs.connection import DBConnectionHandler
from infra.configs.database import Base, Status

T = TypeVar("T", bound=Base)


class BaseRepository(Generic[T]):
    """
    Reposit√≥rio base gen√©rico com CRUD e soft delete.

    Uso:
        class UserRepository(BaseRepository[User]):
            def __init__(self):
                super().__init__(User)

            # M√©todos espec√≠ficos de User aqui...
    """

    def __init__(self, model: Type[T]):
        self.model = model

    # =========================================================================
    # QUERIES BASE (com filtro de soft delete autom√°tico)
    # =========================================================================

    def _base_query(self, session: Session):
        """
        Query base que filtra registros soft-deleted automaticamente.

        TODAS as queries p√∫blicas usam este m√©todo como base.
        Isso garante que registros "deletados" nunca apare√ßam acidentalmente.
        """
        return session.query(self.model).filter(
            self.model.active != Status.INATIVO
        )

    def _base_query_all(self, session: Session):
        """
        Query que inclui TODOS os registros (inclusive soft-deleted).

        Uso: Relat√≥rios de auditoria, restore de registros.
        """
        return session.query(self.model)

    # =========================================================================
    # SELECT (Leitura)
    # =========================================================================

    def select_all(self, include_inactive: bool = False) -> List[dict]:
        """
        Retorna todos os registros ativos.

        Args:
            include_inactive: Se True, inclui registros soft-deleted

        Returns:
            Lista de dicion√°rios (n√£o entidades ORM!)

        Por que retornar dict?
        - Evita problemas de session detached
        - Serializ√°vel diretamente para JSON
        - Mais seguro para APIs
        """
        with DBConnectionHandler() as db:
            if include_inactive:
                data = self._base_query_all(db.session).all()
            else:
                data = self._base_query(db.session).all()
            return [item.to_dict() for item in data]

    def select_by_id(self, id: int, include_inactive: bool = False) -> Optional[dict]:
        """
        Retorna registro por ID.

        Args:
            id: ID do registro
            include_inactive: Se True, busca inclusive em soft-deleted

        Returns:
            Dicion√°rio do registro ou None se n√£o encontrado
        """
        with DBConnectionHandler() as db:
            if include_inactive:
                query = self._base_query_all(db.session)
            else:
                query = self._base_query(db.session)
            data = query.filter(self.model.id == id).first()
            return data.to_dict() if data else None

    def exists(self, id: int) -> bool:
        """Verifica se registro existe (e est√° ativo)."""
        with DBConnectionHandler() as db:
            return (
                self._base_query(db.session)
                .filter(self.model.id == id)
                .first() is not None
            )

    def count(self, include_inactive: bool = False) -> int:
        """Conta registros."""
        with DBConnectionHandler() as db:
            if include_inactive:
                return self._base_query_all(db.session).count()
            return self._base_query(db.session).count()

    # =========================================================================
    # INSERT (Cria√ß√£o)
    # =========================================================================

    def insert(self, entity: T) -> int:
        """
        Insere uma nova entidade.

        Args:
            entity: Inst√¢ncia da entidade a ser inserida

        Returns:
            ID do registro criado

        Importante:
        - flush() envia para o banco mas n√£o commita
        - refresh() busca o ID gerado pelo banco
        - O commit √© feito automaticamente pelo context manager
        """
        with DBConnectionHandler() as db:
            db.session.add(entity)
            db.session.flush()
            db.session.refresh(entity)
            return entity.id

    # =========================================================================
    # UPDATE (Atualiza√ß√£o)
    # =========================================================================

    def update(self, id: int, updated_by: Optional[int] = None, **kwargs) -> bool:
        """
        Atualiza campos espec√≠ficos de um registro.

        Args:
            id: ID do registro
            updated_by: ID do usu√°rio que est√° atualizando (auditoria)
            **kwargs: Campos a serem atualizados

        Returns:
            True se atualizou, False se n√£o encontrou

        Exemplo:
            repo.update(1, updated_by=admin_id, name="Novo Nome", status=Status.ATIVO)
        """
        with DBConnectionHandler() as db:
            query = self._base_query(db.session).filter(self.model.id == id)
            if query.first() is None:
                return False

            if updated_by:
                kwargs['updated_by'] = updated_by

            query.update(kwargs)
            return True

    # =========================================================================
    # SOFT DELETE (Dele√ß√£o L√≥gica)
    # =========================================================================

    def soft_delete(self, id: int, deleted_by: Optional[int] = None) -> bool:
        """
        Marca registro como inativo (soft delete).

        NUNCA deleta fisicamente! Apenas marca:
        - active = INATIVO
        - deleted_at = agora
        - deleted_by = quem deletou

        Args:
            id: ID do registro
            deleted_by: ID do usu√°rio que est√° deletando (auditoria)

        Returns:
            True se deletou, False se n√£o encontrou
        """
        with DBConnectionHandler() as db:
            query = self._base_query(db.session).filter(self.model.id == id)
            if query.first() is None:
                return False

            query.update({
                self.model.active: Status.INATIVO,
                self.model.deleted_at: datetime.now(),
                self.model.deleted_by: deleted_by
            })
            return True

    def restore(self, id: int) -> bool:
        """
        Restaura registro soft-deleted.

        Reverte o soft delete:
        - active = ATIVO
        - deleted_at = None
        - deleted_by = None

        Args:
            id: ID do registro

        Returns:
            True se restaurou, False se n√£o encontrou
        """
        with DBConnectionHandler() as db:
            query = self._base_query_all(db.session).filter(
                self.model.id == id,
                self.model.active == Status.INATIVO
            )
            if query.first() is None:
                return False

            query.update({
                self.model.active: Status.ATIVO,
                self.model.deleted_at: None,
                self.model.deleted_by: None
            })
            return True

    # =========================================================================
    # HARD DELETE (Usar com EXTREMA cautela!)
    # =========================================================================

    def hard_delete(self, id: int) -> bool:
        """
        Remove registro PERMANENTEMENTE do banco.

        ATEN√á√ÉO: Use apenas em casos excepcionais!
        - Dados de teste
        - LGPD (direito ao esquecimento)
        - Registros corrompidos

        Prefira SEMPRE soft_delete()!

        Args:
            id: ID do registro

        Returns:
            True se deletou, False se n√£o encontrou
        """
        with DBConnectionHandler() as db:
            query = db.session.query(self.model).filter(self.model.id == id)
            if query.first() is None:
                return False
            query.delete()
            return True

    # =========================================================================
    # M√âTODOS AUXILIARES (para subclasses)
    # =========================================================================

    def get_entity_by_id(self, id: int, include_inactive: bool = False) -> Optional[T]:
        """
        Retorna a entidade ORM (n√£o dict) para manipula√ß√£o.

        Use quando precisar:
        - Modificar relacionamentos
        - Acessar propriedades computadas
        - Passar para Services

        Args:
            id: ID do registro
            include_inactive: Se True, inclui registros soft-deleted

        Returns:
            Entidade ORM ou None
        """
        with DBConnectionHandler() as db:
            if include_inactive:
                query = self._base_query_all(db.session)
            else:
                query = self._base_query(db.session)
            return query.filter(self.model.id == id).first()
```

#### N√≠vel 5: Herdando BaseRepository (IMPLEMENTA√á√ÉO)

Com o BaseRepository pronto, criar reposit√≥rios espec√≠ficos √© trivial:

```python
# infra/repositories/user_repository.py
from infra.repositories.base_repository import BaseRepository
from infra.entities.user import User

class UserRepository(BaseRepository[User]):
    """
    Reposit√≥rio de User.

    Herda de BaseRepository[User]:
    - T = User
    - Todos os m√©todos CRUD j√° funcionam automaticamente
    - S√≥ adiciona m√©todos ESPEC√çFICOS de User
    """

    def __init__(self):
        # Passa a classe User para o BaseRepository
        super().__init__(User)

    # =========================================================================
    # M√âTODOS ESPEC√çFICOS DE USER (n√£o existem no BaseRepository)
    # =========================================================================

    def get_by_email(self, email: str) -> dict | None:
        """Busca user por email."""
        with DBConnectionHandler() as db:
            user = (
                self._base_query(db.session)
                .filter(User.user_email == email)
                .first()
            )
            return user.to_dict() if user else None

    def get_by_team(self, team_id: int) -> list[dict]:
        """Lista users de um time espec√≠fico."""
        with DBConnectionHandler() as db:
            users = (
                self._base_query(db.session)
                .filter(User.user_team_id == team_id)
                .all()
            )
            return [u.to_dict() for u in users]

    def create(
        self,
        full_name: str,
        email: str,
        password_hash: str,
        team_id: int,
        role: str,
        tipo: str,
        created_by: int | None = None
    ) -> int:
        """
        Cria um novo usu√°rio.

        Este m√©todo existe porque User tem campos espec√≠ficos
        que n√£o podem ser criados genericamente.
        """
        user = User(
            user_full_name=full_name,
            user_email=email,
            user_password=password_hash,
            user_team_id=team_id,
            user_role=role,
            user_tipo=tipo
        )
        user.created_by = created_by
        return self.insert(user)  # Usa o m√©todo herdado!
```

#### Resumo: O Que BaseRepository Oferece

| M√©todo | Descri√ß√£o | Soft Delete? |
|--------|-----------|--------------|
| `select_all()` | Lista todos | Sim, filtra inativos |
| `select_by_id()` | Busca por ID | Sim, filtra inativos |
| `exists()` | Verifica exist√™ncia | Sim, s√≥ ativos |
| `count()` | Conta registros | Configur√°vel |
| `insert()` | Cria registro | N/A |
| `update()` | Atualiza campos | Sim, s√≥ ativos |
| `soft_delete()` | Marca como inativo | √â o soft delete! |
| `restore()` | Restaura deletado | Reverte soft delete |
| `hard_delete()` | Deleta permanente | Ignora |
| `get_entity_by_id()` | Retorna ORM entity | Configur√°vel |

### Service (L√≥gica de Neg√≥cio)

```python
# services/user_service.py
from sqlalchemy.orm import Session, joinedload
from datetime import datetime
from infra.repositories.user_repository import UserRepository
from infra.entities.user import User, UserTipo, UserRoles

class UserService:
    """L√≥gica de neg√≥cio de usu√°rios"""

    def __init__(self, db: Session):
        self.db = db
        self.repo = UserRepository(db)

    def get_user_with_team(self, user_id: int) -> User | None:
        """Busca user com eager loading de team"""
        return (
            self.db.query(User)
            .options(joinedload(User.team))  # Eager load
            .filter(User.id == user_id)
            .filter(User.deleted_at.is_(None))
            .first()
        )

    def create_user(
        self,
        full_name: str,
        email: str,
        password: str,
        team_id: int,
        role: UserRoles,
        tipo: UserTipo
    ) -> User:
        """Cria usu√°rio com valida√ß√µes de neg√≥cio"""

        # Valida√ß√£o: email j√° existe?
        existing = self.repo.get_by_email(email)
        if existing:
            raise ValueError(f"Email {email} j√° est√° em uso")

        # Criar user
        user = User(
            user_full_name=full_name,
            user_email=email,
            user_password=hash_password(password),  # Hash da senha
            user_team_id=team_id,
            user_role=role,
            user_tipo=tipo
        )

        self.repo.create(user)
        self.db.commit()  # Service faz commit
        self.db.refresh(user)

        return user

    def update_user(self, user_id: int, **updates) -> User:
        """Atualiza usu√°rio"""
        user = self.repo.get_by_id(user_id)

        if not user:
            raise ValueError(f"User {user_id} n√£o encontrado")

        if user.deleted_at:
            raise ValueError(f"User {user_id} foi deletado")

        # Atualizar campos
        for key, value in updates.items():
            if value is not None and hasattr(user, key):
                setattr(user, key, value)

        self.repo.update(user)
        self.db.commit()
        self.db.refresh(user)

        return user

    def soft_delete_user(self, user_id: int, deleted_by: int):
        """Soft delete de usu√°rio"""
        user = self.repo.get_by_id(user_id)

        if not user:
            raise ValueError(f"User {user_id} n√£o encontrado")

        if user.deleted_at:
            raise ValueError(f"User {user_id} j√° foi deletado")

        # Soft delete
        user.deleted_at = datetime.now()
        user.deleted_by = deleted_by

        self.repo.update(user)
        self.db.commit()
```

### Vantagens do Service Layer

‚úÖ **Separa√ß√£o de responsabilidades**
- Repository: SQL/banco
- Service: Regras de neg√≥cio
- API: HTTP/valida√ß√£o

‚úÖ **Reusabilidade**
- Services podem ser chamados de m√∫ltiplos endpoints
- L√≥gica n√£o fica duplicada

‚úÖ **Testabilidade**
- Services podem ser testados sem FastAPI
- Repositories podem ser mockados

‚úÖ **Manutenibilidade**
- L√≥gica de neg√≥cio em um s√≥ lugar
- F√°cil encontrar onde alterar

### Devo Popular Dados Usando Services ou Repositories?

**Pergunta comum**: Ao criar dados de teste ou popular o banco, devo usar o Service (com valida√ß√£o) ou o Repository (direto)?

**Resposta**: Depende do contexto e da origem dos dados.

| Contexto | Use | Por qu√™ |
|----------|-----|---------|
| **Produ√ß√£o (dados de usu√°rio)** | Service | Valida√ß√µes de neg√≥cio s√£o aplicadas |
| **Testes unit√°rios** | Repository | Mais r√°pido, sem overhead de valida√ß√£o |
| **Seed/Fixtures iniciais** | Service | Garante dados v√°lidos |
| **Migra√ß√£o de dados legados** | Repository | Performance, dados j√° foram validados antes |

**Em produ√ß√£o (sempre Service)**:

```python
# ‚úÖ Service valida e aplica regras de neg√≥cio
user = user_service.create_user(
    full_name="Matheus",
    email="matheus@email.com",
    password="Pass123!",  # Service faz hash
    team_id=1
)
# O service:
# - Valida email √∫nico
# - Faz hash da senha
# - Verifica se team existe
# - Aplica regras de neg√≥cio
```

**Em testes (pode ser Repository)**:

```python
# Repository √© mais r√°pido para criar dados de teste
user = User(
    user_full_name="Test User",
    user_email="test@test.com",
    user_password="already_hashed_password",  # Voc√™ controla
    user_team_id=1
)
repo.create(user)
# Sem valida√ß√µes = mais r√°pido para setup de testes
```

**Regra geral**: Se os dados v√™m de **fora do sistema** (usu√°rio, API externa, input humano), use Service. Se voc√™ **controla os dados** (testes automatizados, migrations de dados j√° validados), pode usar Repository.

### Conceitos Fundamentais

#### Routers e Organiza√ß√£o

```python
# api/routes/users.py
from fastapi import APIRouter

# Criar router com prefixo e tags
router = APIRouter(
    prefix="/users",           # Todas as rotas come√ßam com /users
    tags=["users"],            # Agrupamento no Swagger
    responses={404: {"description": "Not found"}}  # Respostas padr√£o
)

# Rotas s√£o definidas no router
@router.get("")              # GET /users
@router.get("/{user_id}")    # GET /users/123
@router.post("")             # POST /users
@router.patch("/{user_id}")  # PATCH /users/123
@router.delete("/{user_id}") # DELETE /users/123
```

```python
# main.py - Incluir todos os routers
from fastapi import FastAPI
from api.routes import users, teams, tickets

app = FastAPI(
    title="Portal de Chamados API",
    description="API para gerenciamento de tickets, projetos e relat√≥rios",
    version="1.0.0"
)

# http://localhost:8000/redoc     (ReDoc)
```

#### Dependency Injection (Depends)

**Depends** √© o mecanismo de inje√ß√£o de depend√™ncias do FastAPI. Permite reutilizar c√≥digo e gerenciar recursos.

```python
from fastapi import Depends
from sqlalchemy.orm import Session

# ‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê
# DEPENDS: Inje√ß√£o de depend√™ncias
# ‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê

# Fun√ß√£o geradora de depend√™ncia
def get_db():
    """Cria session do banco e fecha ap√≥s uso."""
    db = SessionLocal()
    try:
        yield db  # yield = retorna e continua ap√≥s o endpoint
    finally:
        db.close()

# Uso no endpoint
@router.get("")
def list_users(db: Session = Depends(get_db)):
    # db j√° √© uma session aberta
    return db.query(User).all()
    # Ap√≥s retornar, o finally do get_db() √© executado

# ‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê
# DEPEND√äNCIAS ENCADEADAS
# ‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê

def get_current_user(
    token: str = Depends(oauth2_scheme),
    db: Session = Depends(get_db)
) -> User:
    """Valida token e retorna usu√°rio."""
    user = validate_token_and_get_user(token, db)
    if not user:
        raise HTTPException(401, "Token inv√°lido")
    return user

def get_current_active_user(
    current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user)
) -> User:
    """Verifica se usu√°rio est√° ativo."""
    if not current_user.is_active:
        raise HTTPException(400, "Usu√°rio inativo")
    return current_user

# Uso: FastAPI resolve toda a cadeia automaticamente
@router.get("/me")
def get_me(user: User = Depends(get_current_active_user)):
    return user  # Token validado + usu√°rio ativo
```

#### HTTPException (Tratamento de Erros)

```python
from fastapi import HTTPException, status

# ‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê
# HTTPException: Erros HTTP com mensagem
# ‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê

@router.get("/{user_id}")
def get_user(user_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db)):
    user = db.query(User).filter(User.id == user_id).first()

    if not user:
        raise HTTPException(
            status_code=status.HTTP_404_NOT_FOUND,
            detail="Usu√°rio n√£o encontrado"
        )

    if user.deleted_at:
        raise HTTPException(
            status_code=status.HTTP_410_GONE,
            detail="Usu√°rio foi removido"
        )

    return user

# ‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê
# C√ìDIGOS HTTP COMUNS
# ‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê

# 2xx Sucesso
status.HTTP_200_OK              # GET, PUT, PATCH com retorno
status.HTTP_201_CREATED         # POST criou recurso
status.HTTP_204_NO_CONTENT      # DELETE sem retorno

# 4xx Erro do Cliente
status.HTTP_400_BAD_REQUEST     # Requisi√ß√£o inv√°lida
status.HTTP_401_UNAUTHORIZED    # N√£o autenticado
status.HTTP_403_FORBIDDEN       # N√£o autorizado (autenticado, mas sem permiss√£o)
status.HTTP_404_NOT_FOUND       # Recurso n√£o existe
status.HTTP_409_CONFLICT        # Conflito (ex: email j√° existe)
status.HTTP_422_UNPROCESSABLE_ENTITY  # Valida√ß√£o falhou

# 5xx Erro do Servidor
status.HTTP_500_INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR  # Erro gen√©rico
status.HTTP_503_SERVICE_UNAVAILABLE    # Servi√ßo indispon√≠vel
```

#### Response Model (Controle de Resposta)

```python
from pydantic import BaseModel

# ‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê
# RESPONSE MODEL: Controla o que √© retornado
# ‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê

class UserResponse(BaseModel):
    id: int
    nome: str
    email: str
    # NOTA: password_hash N√ÉO est√° aqui - n√£o vai para a resposta!

    model_config = {"from_attributes": True}

@router.get("/{user_id}", response_model=UserResponse)
def get_user(user_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db)):
    user = db.query(User).filter(User.id == user_id).first()
    # user tem password_hash, mas FastAPI filtra usando o response_model
    return user  # Resposta s√≥ tem id, nome, email

# Op√ß√µes do response_model
@router.get(
    "",
    response_model=list[UserResponse],      # Lista de schemas
    response_model_exclude_none=True,       # Remove campos None
    response_model_exclude_unset=True,      # Remove campos n√£o setados
    response_model_exclude={"email"},       # Exclui campos espec√≠ficos
    response_model_include={"id", "nome"}   # Inclui apenas estes
)
def list_users():
    ...
```

### Arquitetura Completa

```python
# api/endpoints/users.py
from fastapi import APIRouter, Depends, HTTPException, Query
from sqlalchemy.orm import Session
from typing import Literal

from infra.configs.connection import get_db
from services.user_service import UserService
from schemas.user_schemas import (
    UserList,
    UserDetail,
    UserWithTeam,
    UserCreate,
    UserUpdate
)

router = APIRouter(prefix="/users", tags=["users"])


# ‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê
# GET /users - Listar usu√°rios
# ‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê

@router.get("", response_model=list[UserList])
def list_users(
    limit: int = Query(100, ge=1, le=1000),
    offset: int = Query(0, ge=0),
    db: Session = Depends(get_db)
):
    """Lista usu√°rios ativos"""
    service = UserService(db)
    users = service.repo.list_active(limit=limit, offset=offset)
    return users

# GET /users/{user_id} - Detalhe do usu√°rio
# ‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê

@router.get("/{user_id}", response_model=UserWithTeam)
def get_user(
    user_id: int,
    include: list[str] = Query(None, description="Relationships: team, tickets"),
    db: Session = Depends(get_db)
):
    """
    Retorna detalhes do usu√°rio.

    **Query params**:
    - `include`: Lista de relationships para incluir (ex: `?include=team&include=tickets`)
    """
    service = UserService(db)

    # include=team ‚Üí carregar team
    if include and "team" in include:
        user = service.get_user_with_team(user_id)
    else:
        user = service.repo.get_by_id(user_id)

    if not user or user.deleted_at:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="User n√£o encontrado")

    return user

# POST /users - Criar usu√°rio
# ‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê

@router.post("", response_model=UserDetail, status_code=201)
def create_user(
    user_data: UserCreate,
    db: Session = Depends(get_db)
):
    """Cria novo usu√°rio"""
    service = UserService(db)

    try:
        user = service.create_user(
            full_name=user_data.user_full_name,
            email=user_data.user_email,
            password=user_data.user_password,
            team_id=user_data.user_team_id,
            role=user_data.user_role,
            tipo=user_data.user_tipo
        )
        return user

    except ValueError as e:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=400, detail=str(e))

# PATCH /users/{user_id} - Atualizar usu√°rio
# ‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê

@router.patch("/{user_id}", response_model=UserDetail)
def update_user(
    user_id: int,
    user_data: UserUpdate,
    db: Session = Depends(get_db)
):
    """Atualiza usu√°rio (campos opcionais)"""
    service = UserService(db)

    try:
        # S√≥ passa campos n√£o-None
        updates = user_data.model_dump(exclude_unset=True)
        user = service.update_user(user_id, **updates)
        return user

    except ValueError as e:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=400, detail=str(e))


# ‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê
# DELETE /users/{user_id} - Deletar usu√°rio
# ‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê

@router.delete("/{user_id}", status_code=204)
def delete_user(
    user_id: int,
    deleted_by: int = Query(..., description="ID do usu√°rio que est√° deletando"),
    db: Session = Depends(get_db)
):
    """Soft delete de usu√°rio"""
    service = UserService(db)

    try:
        service.soft_delete_user(user_id, deleted_by=deleted_by)
        return None  # 204 No Content

    except ValueError as e:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=400, detail=str(e))
```

### Query Params Din√¢micos (include)

**Padr√£o RESTful**: Permitir cliente escolher o que incluir.

```python
@router.get("/{user_id}")
def get_user(
    user_id: int,
    include: list[str] = Query(None),
    db: Session = Depends(get_db)
):
    from sqlalchemy.orm import joinedload, selectinload

    query = db.query(User).filter(User.id == user_id)

    # Eager load din√¢mico
    if include:
        if "team" in include:
            query = query.options(joinedload(User.team))

        if "tickets" in include:
            query = query.options(selectinload(User.tickets_att))

    user = query.first()

    if not user:
        raise HTTPException(404, "User n√£o encontrado")

    return user


# Uso:
# GET /users/1                    ‚Üí S√≥ dados do user
# GET /users/1?include=team       ‚Üí User + team
# GET /users/1?include=team&include=tickets ‚Üí User + team + tickets
```

## 4.0 O ALVO: Analytics Service - Estado da Arte

Antes de come√ßar, veja como fica um Analytics Service completo que voc√™ ser√° capaz de implementar ao final deste m√≥dulo. Este √© o **alvo** - o n√≠vel de qualidade profissional que buscamos.

### Dashboard de M√©tricas - Estado da Arte

```python
# ‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê
# ANALYTICS SERVICE - ESTADO DA ARTE
# ‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê

from sqlalchemy import func, case, extract, and_
from sqlalchemy.orm import Session
from datetime import datetime, timedelta
from typing import TypedDict

class TeamMetrics(TypedDict):
    """M√©tricas de um time."""
    team_id: int
    team_name: str
    total_tickets: int
    tickets_open: int
    tickets_closed: int
    avg_resolution_hours: float
    satisfaction_avg: float
    sla_compliance_percent: float


class TicketAnalyticsService:
    """
    Service de Analytics para Tickets.

    Fornece m√©tricas operacionais e estrat√©gicas para dashboards.
    """

    def __init__(self, session: Session):
        self.session = session

    def get_team_performance_dashboard(
        self,
        start_date: datetime,
        end_date: datetime
    ) -> list[TeamMetrics]:
        """
        Dashboard de performance por time.

        M√©tricas:
        - Total de tickets no per√≠odo
        - Tickets abertos vs fechados
        - Tempo m√©dio de resolu√ß√£o (em horas)
        - Satisfa√ß√£o m√©dia do cliente
        - % de cumprimento de SLA
        """
        result = self.session.query(
            Team.id.label("team_id"),
            Team.team_name.label("team_name"),

            # Total de tickets
            func.count(Ticket.id).label("total_tickets"),

            # Tickets por status
            func.sum(
                case((Ticket.ticket_status == TicketStatus.ABERTO, 1), else_=0)
            ).label("tickets_open"),

            func.sum(
                case((Ticket.ticket_status == TicketStatus.ENCERRADO, 1), else_=0)
            ).label("tickets_closed"),

            # Tempo m√©dio de resolu√ß√£o (s√≥ tickets fechados)
            func.avg(
                case(
                    (Ticket.ticket_closed_at.isnot(None),
                     extract('epoch', Ticket.ticket_closed_at - Ticket.created_at) / 3600),
                    else_=None
                )
            ).label("avg_resolution_hours"),

            # Satisfa√ß√£o m√©dia
            func.avg(Ticket.ticket_satisfaction_rating).label("satisfaction_avg"),

            # SLA compliance (fechados antes do deadline)
            (func.sum(
                case(
                    (and_(
                        Ticket.ticket_closed_at.isnot(None),
                        Ticket.ticket_closed_at <= Ticket.ticket_deadline
                    ), 1),
                    else_=0
                )
            ) * 100.0 / func.nullif(func.count(Ticket.id), 0)).label("sla_compliance_percent")

        ).select_from(Team
        ).outerjoin(TicketTeam, Team.id == TicketTeam.team_id
        ).outerjoin(Ticket, TicketTeam.ticket_id == Ticket.id
        ).filter(
            Ticket.created_at.between(start_date, end_date)
        ).group_by(Team.id, Team.team_name
        ).all()

        return [TeamMetrics(**row._asdict()) for row in result]

    def get_tickets_by_status_trend(
        self,
        days: int = 30
    ) -> list[dict]:
        """
        Tend√™ncia de tickets por status nos √∫ltimos N dias.

        Retorna dados para gr√°fico de linha temporal.
        """
        start_date = datetime.now() - timedelta(days=days)

        result = self.session.query(
            func.date_trunc('day', Ticket.created_at).label("date"),
            Ticket.ticket_status.label("status"),
            func.count(Ticket.id).label("count")
        ).filter(
            Ticket.created_at >= start_date
        ).group_by(
            func.date_trunc('day', Ticket.created_at),
            Ticket.ticket_status
        ).order_by("date").all()

        return [{"date": row.date, "status": row.status.value, "count": row.count} for row in result]
```

```python
# ‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê
```

## 4.2 N√çVEL 2: GROUP BY - Agrupando Resultados üìö B√ÅSICO

> **N√≠vel**: B√ÅSICO - Agrupe dados por categorias.

### Evoluindo: Agrega√ß√£o Por Grupo

Agora queremos saber "quantos tickets **por status**" ou "m√©dia **por time**":

```python
# ‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê
# ANALYTICS N√çVEL 2: GROUP BY
# ‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê

# === Tickets por Status ===
tickets_por_status = session.query(
    Ticket.status,
    func.count(Ticket.id).label("total")
).group_by(Ticket.status).all()

# Retorna:
# [('aberto', 342), ('em_andamento', 156), ('fechado', 1025)]


# === Tickets por Time ===
tickets_por_time = session.query(
    Team.team_name,
    func.count(Ticket.id).label("total"),
    func.avg(Ticket.satisfaction).label("satisfacao_media")
).join(Ticket.team
).group_by(Team.team_name).all()

# Retorna:
# [('Analytics', 450, 8.7), ('Suporte', 623, 8.2), ('Projetos', 450, 8.9)]


# === HAVING: Filtrar DEPOIS de agrupar ===
times_com_muitos_tickets = session.query(
    Team.team_name,
    func.count(Ticket.id).label("total")
).join(Ticket.team
).group_by(Team.team_name
).having(func.count(Ticket.id) > 100  # ‚úÖ Filtra grupos, n√£o registros
).all()
```

## 4.3 N√çVEL 3: CASE e L√≥gica Condicional üìó INTERMEDI√ÅRIO

> **N√≠vel**: INTERMEDI√ÅRIO - Agrega√ß√µes condicionais e subqueries.

### Evoluindo: L√≥gica Dentro da Query

Agora queremos "contar tickets abertos E fechados na mesma query":

```python
# ‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê
# ANALYTICS N√çVEL 3: CASE E SUBQUERIES
# ‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê

from sqlalchemy import case, and_, or_

# === CASE: IF/ELSE dentro da query ===
metricas_por_time = session.query(
    Team.team_name,

    # Conta TODOS
    func.count(Ticket.id).label("total"),

    # Conta s√≥ ABERTOS (case como filtro condicional)
    func.sum(
        case((Ticket.status == 'aberto', 1), else_=0)
    ).label("abertos"),

    # Conta s√≥ FECHADOS
    func.sum(
        case((Ticket.status == 'fechado', 1), else_=0)
    ).label("fechados"),

    # Calcula PERCENTUAL de fechados
    (func.sum(case((Ticket.status == 'fechado', 1), else_=0)) * 100.0 /
     func.nullif(func.count(Ticket.id), 0)  # nullif evita divis√£o por zero
    ).label("percent_fechados")

).join(Ticket.team
).group_by(Team.team_name).all()

# Retorna:
# [('Analytics', 450, 50, 380, 84.4), ('Suporte', 623, 120, 480, 77.0)]


# === Condi√ß√µes complexas ===
tickets_urgentes_atrasados = session.query(
    func.count(Ticket.id)
).filter(
    and_(
        Ticket.priority == 'urgente',
        Ticket.status != 'fechado',
        Ticket.deadline < func.now()  # Passou do prazo
    )
).scalar()
```

```
‚îÇ                                                                             ‚îÇ

‚îÇ   ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ              ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ                     ‚îÇ
‚îÇ                                                                             ‚îÇ
```

## 4.4 N√çVEL 4: Estado da Arte - Analytics Service Completo üìï AVAN√áADO

> **N√≠vel**: ESTADO DA ARTE - Service de analytics profissional.

Este √© o c√≥digo completo que voc√™ viu na se√ß√£o **4.0 O ALVO**. Agora voc√™ entende cada parte:

```python
# ‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê
# ANALYTICS SERVICE - ESTADO DA ARTE
# ‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê

from sqlalchemy import func, case, extract, and_
from sqlalchemy.orm import Session
from datetime import datetime, timedelta
from pydantic import BaseModel


class TeamMetrics(BaseModel):
    """Schema de m√©tricas de time."""
    team_id: int
    team_name: str
    total_tickets: int
    tickets_open: int
    tickets_closed: int
    avg_resolution_hours: float | None
    satisfaction_avg: float | None
    sla_compliance_percent: float | None


class TicketAnalyticsService:
    """
    Service de Analytics - Estado da Arte.

    Princ√≠pios:
    - Uma query por m√©todo (evita N+1)
    - C√°lculos no banco (n√£o em Python)
    - Schemas tipados para retorno
    - Filtros por per√≠odo
    """

    def __init__(self, session: Session):
        self.session = session

    def get_team_dashboard(
        self,
        start_date: datetime,
        end_date: datetime
    ) -> list[TeamMetrics]:
        """
        Dashboard completo de performance por time.

        M√©tricas em UMA √öNICA query:
        - Total, abertos, fechados
        - Tempo m√©dio de resolu√ß√£o
        - Satisfa√ß√£o m√©dia
        - % SLA compliance
        """
        result = self.session.query(
            Team.id.label("team_id"),
            Team.team_name,

            func.count(Ticket.id).label("total_tickets"),

            func.sum(case(
                (Ticket.status == TicketStatus.ABERTO, 1), else_=0
            )).label("tickets_open"),

            func.sum(case(
                (Ticket.status == TicketStatus.FECHADO, 1), else_=0
            )).label("tickets_closed"),

            func.avg(case(
                (Ticket.closed_at.isnot(None),
                 extract('epoch', Ticket.closed_at - Ticket.created_at) / 3600),
                else_=None
            )).label("avg_resolution_hours"),

            func.avg(Ticket.satisfaction_rating).label("satisfaction_avg"),

            (func.sum(case(
                (and_(
                    Ticket.closed_at.isnot(None),
                    Ticket.closed_at <= Ticket.deadline
                ), 1), else_=0
            )) * 100.0 / func.nullif(func.count(Ticket.id), 0)
            ).label("sla_compliance_percent")

        ).outerjoin(Ticket, Team.id == Ticket.team_id
        ).filter(Ticket.created_at.between(start_date, end_date)
        ).group_by(Team.id, Team.team_name
        ).all()

        return [TeamMetrics(**row._asdict()) for row in result]

    def get_daily_trend(self, days: int = 30) -> list[dict]:
        """Tend√™ncia di√°ria para gr√°ficos."""
        start = datetime.now() - timedelta(days=days)

        return self.session.query(
            func.date_trunc('day', Ticket.created_at).label("date"),
            func.count(Ticket.id).label("count")
        ).filter(Ticket.created_at >= start
        ).group_by(func.date_trunc('day', Ticket.created_at)
        ).order_by("date").all()
```

## üìö T√ìPICOS ESPECIALIZADOS (Refer√™ncia Detalhada)

## 4.5 Refer√™ncia: Queries de Agrega√ß√£o em Detalhe

### Entendendo Agrega√ß√µes

**Agrega√ß√£o** √© quando voc√™ **resume m√∫ltiplos registros em um √∫nico valor**.

**Analogia**: Imagine uma pilha de 1000 notas fiscais. Agrega√ß√£o √© quando voc√™:
- **Soma** todas para saber o total gasto (SUM)
- **Conta** quantas notas tem (COUNT)
- **Calcula m√©dia** de valor por nota (AVG)
- **Pega** o maior valor (MAX)
- **Pega** o menor valor (MIN)

Sem agrega√ß√£o: 1000 registros
Com agrega√ß√£o: 1 n√∫mero que resume tudo

### As 5 Fun√ß√µes de Agrega√ß√£o B√°sicas

#### 1. COUNT - Contar Registros

**O que faz**: Conta quantos registros existem.

```python
# Quantos tickets existem?
total = db.query(func.count(Ticket.id)).scalar()
# Retorna: 1523 (um n√∫mero)
```

**SQL Equivalente**:
```sql
SELECT COUNT(tickets.id) AS count_1 FROM tickets;
-- Resultado: 1523
```

**Quando usar**:
- Total de registros
- Quantos tickets por status
- Quantos usu√°rios ativos

**Varia√ß√µes**:
```python
# COUNT(*) - conta todas as linhas
db.query(func.count()).select_from(Ticket).scalar()

# COUNT(coluna) - conta apenas n√£o-NULL
db.query(func.count(Ticket.closed_at)).scalar()  # S√≥ tickets fechados

# COUNT(DISTINCT coluna) - conta valores √∫nicos
db.query(func.count(Ticket.ticket_client_id.distinct())).scalar()  # Quantos clientes diferentes
```

**SQLs Equivalentes**:
```sql
-- COUNT(*)
SELECT COUNT(*) AS count_1 FROM tickets;

-- COUNT(coluna) - apenas n√£o-NULL
SELECT COUNT(tickets.closed_at) AS count_1 FROM tickets;

-- COUNT(DISTINCT)
SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT tickets.ticket_client_id) AS count_1 FROM tickets;
```

#### 2. SUM - Somar Valores

**O que faz**: Soma valores num√©ricos.

```python
# Soma de horas trabalhadas
total_hours = db.query(func.sum(Ticket.hours_worked)).scalar()
# Retorna: 45234.5 (soma de todas as horas)
```

**SQL Equivalente**:
```sql
SELECT SUM(tickets.hours_worked) AS sum_1 FROM tickets;
-- Resultado: 45234.5
```

**Quando usar**:
- Total de valores financeiros
- Soma de horas/dura√ß√£o
- Total de itens

**‚ö†Ô∏è Cuidado**: SUM retorna None se n√£o houver registros!
```python
# ‚úÖ Seguro:
total = db.query(func.coalesce(func.sum(Ticket.hours_worked), 0)).scalar()
```

**SQL com COALESCE**:
```sql
SELECT COALESCE(SUM(tickets.hours_worked), 0) AS coalesce_1 FROM tickets;
-- Retorna 0 se n√£o houver registros (ao inv√©s de NULL)
```

#### 3. AVG - Calcular M√©dia

**O que faz**: Calcula m√©dia aritm√©tica.

```python
# Tempo m√©dio de resolu√ß√£o (em horas)
avg_time = db.query(
    func.avg(
        extract('epoch', Ticket.closed_at - Ticket.created_at) / 3600
    )
).scalar()
# Retorna: 48.3 (horas)
```

**SQL Equivalente**:
```sql
SELECT AVG(
    EXTRACT(epoch FROM tickets.closed_at - tickets.created_at) / 3600
) AS avg_1
FROM tickets;
-- Resultado: 48.3 (m√©dia de horas para resolver tickets)
```

**Quando usar**:
- Tempo m√©dio de atendimento
- Nota m√©dia de satisfa√ß√£o
- Valor m√©dio por transa√ß√£o

**‚ö†Ô∏è Importante**: AVG ignora valores NULL automaticamente.

#### 4. MAX - Valor M√°ximo

**O que faz**: Retorna o maior valor.

```python
# Ticket mais antigo ainda aberto
oldest_open = db.query(func.min(Ticket.created_at)).filter(
    Ticket.ticket_status == TicketStatus.ABERTO
).scalar()
```

**SQL Equivalente**:
```sql
SELECT MIN(tickets.created_at) AS min_1
FROM tickets
WHERE tickets.ticket_status = 'aberto';
-- Resultado: '2024-01-15 09:30:00' (data do ticket aberto mais antigo)
```

**Quando usar**:
- Data mais recente/antiga
- Maior valor
- Pior performance

#### 5. MIN - Valor M√≠nimo

**O que faz**: Retorna o menor valor.

```python
# Ticket resolvido mais r√°pido
fastest = db.query(
    func.min(Ticket.closed_at - Ticket.created_at)
).scalar()
```

**SQL Equivalente**:
```sql
SELECT MIN(tickets.closed_at - tickets.created_at) AS min_1
FROM tickets;
-- Resultado: '00:15:00' (15 minutos - ticket mais r√°pido)
```

### Agrega√ß√£o com GROUP BY

**GROUP BY** divide registros em grupos e aplica agrega√ß√£o em cada grupo.

**Analogia**: Imagine gavetas organizadas por cor. GROUP BY separa em gavetas, agrega√ß√£o conta/soma dentro de cada gaveta.

```python
# Tickets POR STATUS (grupos)
status_counts = (
    db.query(
        Ticket.ticket_status,              # ‚Üê Coluna de agrupamento
        func.count(Ticket.id).label("count")  # ‚Üê Agrega√ß√£o
    )
    .group_by(Ticket.ticket_status)        # ‚Üê Divide em grupos
    .all()
)

# Resultado:
# [(TicketStatus.ABERTO, 45),
#  (TicketStatus.ATIVO, 123),
#  (TicketStatus.CONCLUIDO, 890)]
```

**SQL Equivalente**:
```sql
SELECT
    tickets.ticket_status,
    COUNT(tickets.id) AS count
FROM tickets
GROUP BY tickets.ticket_status;

-- Resultado:
-- ticket_status | count
-- --------------+-------
-- aberto        | 45
-- ativo         | 123
-- concluido     | 890
```

**Regra de Ouro do GROUP BY**:

```
Se voc√™ usa GROUP BY, s√≥ pode SELECT:
1. Colunas do GROUP BY
2. Fun√ß√µes de agrega√ß√£o (COUNT, SUM, etc.)

‚ùå ERRADO:
SELECT ticket_title, COUNT(*)  ‚Üê ticket_title n√£o est√° no GROUP BY!
FROM tickets
GROUP BY ticket_status

‚úÖ CORRETO:
SELECT ticket_status, COUNT(*)
FROM tickets
GROUP BY ticket_status
```

### COUNT, SUM, AVG, MIN, MAX - Exemplos Pr√°ticos

```python

# Total de tickets

# Tickets por status
```

### Agrega√ß√µes Complexas

```python
from sqlalchemy import case, extract

# Tempo m√©dio de resolu√ß√£o por prioridade
avg_resolution_time = (
    db.query(
        Ticket.ticket_priority,
        func.avg(
            extract('epoch', Ticket.closed_at - Ticket.created_at) / 3600
```

## 4.6 Refer√™ncia: Analytics Service Patterns

### Estrutura

```python
# services/analytics_service.py
from sqlalchemy.orm import Session
from sqlalchemy import func, case, extract
from datetime import datetime, timedelta

class AnalyticsService:
    def __init__(self, db: Session):
        self.db = db

    def get_ticket_stats(
        self,
        start_date: datetime | None = None,
        end_date: datetime | None = None,
        team_id: int | None = None
    ) -> dict:
        """
        Estat√≠sticas de tickets com filtros opcionais
        """
        query = self.db.query(Ticket)

        # Aplicar filtros
        if start_date:
            query = query.filter(Ticket.created_at >= start_date)
        if end_date:
            query = query.filter(Ticket.created_at <= end_date)
        if team_id:
            query = (
                query
                .join(User, Ticket.ticket_client_id == User.id)
                .filter(User.user_team_id == team_id)
            )

        # Agrega√ß√µes
        total = query.count()

        by_status = (
            query
            .with_entities(
                Ticket.ticket_status,
                func.count(Ticket.id).label("count")
            )
            .group_by(Ticket.ticket_status)
            .all()
        )

        avg_resolution = (
            query
            .filter(Ticket.closed_at.isnot(None))
            .with_entities(
                func.avg(
                    extract('epoch', Ticket.closed_at - Ticket.created_at) / 3600
                )
            )
            .scalar()
        )

        return {
            "total": total,
            "by_status": {status.value: count for status, count in by_status},
            "avg_resolution_hours": float(avg_resolution) if avg_resolution else None
        }

    def get_team_performance(self) -> list[dict]:
        """Performance de cada time"""
        results = (
            self.db.query(
                Team.id,
                Team.team_name,
                func.count(Ticket.id).label("total_tickets"),
                func.sum(
                    case((Ticket.ticket_status == TicketStatus.CONCLUIDO, 1), else_=0)
                ).label("resolved_tickets"),
                func.avg(
                    case(
                        (
                            Ticket.closed_at.isnot(None),
                            extract('epoch', Ticket.closed_at - Ticket.created_at) / 3600
                        )
                    )
                ).label("avg_resolution_hours")
            )
            .join(User, Team.id == User.user_team_id)
            .join(Ticket, User.id == Ticket.ticket_attendant_id)
            .group_by(Team.id, Team.team_name)
            .all()
        )

        return [
            {
                "team_id": r.id,
                "team_name": r.team_name,
                "total_tickets": r.total_tickets,
                "resolved_tickets": r.resolved_tickets,
                "resolution_rate": (r.resolved_tickets / r.total_tickets * 100) if r.total_tickets > 0 else 0,
                "avg_resolution_hours": float(r.avg_resolution_hours) if r.avg_resolution_hours else None
            }
            for r in results
        ]
```

### Endpoint de Analytics

```python
@router.get("/analytics/tickets")
def ticket_analytics(
    start_date: datetime | None = None,
    end_date: datetime | None = None,
    team_id: int | None = None,
    db: Session = Depends(get_db)
):
    """Estat√≠sticas de tickets"""
    service = AnalyticsService(db)
    return service.get_ticket_stats(start_date, end_date, team_id)


@router.get("/analytics/teams")
def team_analytics(db: Session = Depends(get_db)):
    """Performance dos times"""
    service = AnalyticsService(db)
    return service.get_team_performance()
```

## 4.7 Refer√™ncia: Otimiza√ß√µes Avan√ßadas

### 1. Subqueries

```python
from sqlalchemy import select

# Subquery: total de tickets por usu√°rio
tickets_count = (
    select(
        Ticket.ticket_client_id,
        func.count(Ticket.id).label("ticket_count")
    )
    .group_by(Ticket.ticket_client_id)
    .subquery()
)

# Query principal: usu√°rios com contagem
users_with_count = (
    db.query(
        User.id,
        User.user_full_name,
        func.coalesce(tickets_count.c.ticket_count, 0).label("tickets")
    )
    .outerjoin(tickets_count, User.id == tickets_count.c.ticket_client_id)
    .all()
)
```

### 2. Window Functions

```python
from sqlalchemy import over

# Ranking de atendentes por n√∫mero de tickets resolvidos
ranking = (
    db.query(
        User.user_full_name,
        func.count(Ticket.id).label("resolved"),
        func.rank().over(
            order_by=func.count(Ticket.id).desc()
        ).label("rank")
    )
    .join(Ticket, User.id == Ticket.ticket_attendant_id)
    .filter(Ticket.ticket_status == TicketStatus.CONCLUIDO)
    .group_by(User.user_full_name)
    .all()
)
```

### 3. Batch Loading

```python
# ‚ùå N+1 Problem
users = db.query(User).all()
for user in users:
    print(user.team.team_name)  # 1 query por user!

# ‚úÖ Solu√ß√£o: selectinload
from sqlalchemy.orm import selectinload

users = db.query(User).options(selectinload(User.team)).all()
for user in users:
    print(user.team.team_name)  # Total: 2 queries!
```

## 4.8 Refer√™ncia: √çndices e Performance

### Entendendo √çndices: A Analogia do Livro

**Problema**: Imagine que voc√™ precisa encontrar todas as p√°ginas onde aparece a palavra "SQLAlchemy" em um livro de 1000 p√°ginas.

**Sem √≠ndice**: Voc√™ l√™ TODAS as 1000 p√°ginas, uma por uma. Demora horas.

**Com √≠ndice**: Voc√™ vai direto ao √≠ndice remissivo no final do livro, v√™ "SQLAlchemy: p√°ginas 45, 123, 567" e vai direto l√°. Demora segundos.

**√çndices de banco de dados funcionam exatamente assim.**

### O Que √â um √çndice?

**√çndice** √© uma estrutura de dados auxiliar que permite ao banco encontrar registros rapidamente sem fazer um **table scan** (ler toda a tabela).

```
Sem √çndice (Table Scan):
‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
‚îÇ users table (1 milh√£o de registros)   ‚îÇ
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î§
‚îÇ id=1  name=Ana    email=ana@...       ‚îÇ ‚Üê L√™ linha 1
‚îÇ id=2  name=Bruno  email=bruno@...     ‚îÇ ‚Üê L√™ linha 2
‚îÇ id=3  name=Carlos email=carlos@...    ‚îÇ ‚Üê L√™ linha 3
‚îÇ ...                                    ‚îÇ ‚Üê L√™ TUDO
‚îÇ id=999999 name=Zoe email=zoe@...      ‚îÇ ‚Üê L√™ linha 999999
‚îÇ id=1000000 name=Matheus email=...     ‚îÇ ‚Üê ACHOU! (depois de ler tudo)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
Tempo: ~5 segundos (lento!)

Com √çndice em email:
‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
‚îÇ √çndice (estrutura B-Tree ordenada)    ‚îÇ
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î§
‚îÇ ana@... ‚Üí linha 1                      ‚îÇ
‚îÇ bruno@... ‚Üí linha 2                    ‚îÇ
‚îÇ ...                                    ‚îÇ
‚îÇ matheus@... ‚Üí linha 1000000            ‚îÇ ‚Üê Busca bin√°ria
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
         ‚Üì (vai direto √† linha)
‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
‚îÇ id=1000000 name=Matheus email=...     ‚îÇ ‚Üê ACHOU! (direto)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
Tempo: ~5 milissegundos (1000x mais r√°pido!)
```

### Tipos de √çndices

#### 1. Primary Key (√≠ndice autom√°tico)

```python
class User(Base):
    id: Mapped[int] = mapped_column(primary_key=True)
    # ‚Üë Automaticamente cria √≠ndice √∫nico em id
```

**Caracter√≠sticas**:
- ‚úÖ Sempre √∫nico
- ‚úÖ Sempre indexado
- ‚úÖ Busca por ID √© O(log n) - muito r√°pida

#### 2. √çndice Simples

```python
class Ticket(Base):
    ticket_title: Mapped[str] = mapped_column(String(200), index=True)
    #                                                        ‚Üë
    #                                               Cria √≠ndice
```

**SQL Gerado**:
```sql
CREATE INDEX ix_tickets_ticket_title ON tickets(ticket_title);
```

**Quando usar**:
- Colunas usadas em WHERE frequentemente
- Colunas usadas em ORDER BY
- Colunas de relacionamento (foreign keys)

#### 3. √çndice √önico (UNIQUE)

```python
class User(Base):
    user_email: Mapped[str] = mapped_column(String(100), unique=True)
    #                                                      ‚Üë
    #                                         √çndice √∫nico + constraint
```

**SQL Gerado**:
```sql
CREATE UNIQUE INDEX ix_users_user_email ON users(user_email);
```

**Caracter√≠sticas**:
- ‚úÖ Garante valores √∫nicos
- ‚úÖ Busca r√°pida
- ‚úÖ Previne duplicatas

#### 4. √çndice Composto (M√∫ltiplas Colunas)

```python
class Ticket(Base):
    __tablename__ = "tickets"

    ticket_status: Mapped[TicketStatus] = mapped_column()
    created_at: Mapped[datetime] = mapped_column()

    # √çndice composto (status + data)
    __table_args__ = (
        Index("ix_ticket_status_created", "ticket_status", "created_at"),
    )
```

**SQL Gerado**:
```sql
CREATE INDEX ix_ticket_status_created ON tickets(ticket_status, created_at);
```

**Quando usar**:
- Queries que filtram por m√∫ltiplas colunas juntas
- A ordem das colunas IMPORTA!

**Ordem das Colunas**:

```python
# √çndice: (status, created_at)

# ‚úÖ USA o √≠ndice:
WHERE status = 'ABERTO'
WHERE status = 'ABERTO' AND created_at > '2024-01-01'

# ‚ùå N√ÉO USA o √≠ndice completo:
WHERE created_at > '2024-01-01'  # S√≥ usa se status tamb√©m estiver

# Regra: √çndice (A, B, C) funciona para:
# - A
# - A, B
# - A, B, C
# MAS N√ÉO para: B, C ou apenas C
```

### Trade-offs de √çndices

#### Vantagens

‚úÖ **Busca extremamente r√°pida**
- Table scan: O(n) - l√™ tudo
- √çndice: O(log n) - busca bin√°ria

‚úÖ **ORDER BY mais r√°pido**
- Sem √≠ndice: precisa ordenar em mem√≥ria
- Com √≠ndice: j√° est√° ordenado

‚úÖ **JOIN mais eficiente**
- Foreign keys devem SEMPRE ter √≠ndice

#### Desvantagens

‚ùå **Ocupa espa√ßo em disco**
- Cada √≠ndice duplica parte dos dados
- √çndice pode ser maior que a pr√≥pria tabela

‚ùå **INSERT/UPDATE/DELETE mais lentos**
- Precisa atualizar o √≠ndice tamb√©m
- Mais √≠ndices = mais trabalho

‚ùå **Manuten√ß√£o**
- √çndices podem fragmentar
- Precisam de VACUUM/REINDEX peri√≥dico

### Quando Criar √çndices

‚úÖ **CRIE √≠ndices** quando:

1. **Coluna em WHERE frequente**
   ```python
   # Se voc√™ faz muito:
   WHERE user_email = '...'
   # Crie √≠ndice em user_email
   ```

2. **Coluna em JOIN**
   ```python
   # Foreign keys sempre devem ter √≠ndice
   user_team_id: Mapped[int] = mapped_column(
       ForeignKey("teams.id"),
       index=True  # ‚úÖ
   )
   ```

3. **Coluna em ORDER BY**
   ```python
   # Se voc√™ faz muito:
   ORDER BY created_at DESC
   # Crie √≠ndice em created_at
   ```

4. **Alta cardinalidade** (muitos valores √∫nicos)
   ```python
   # ‚úÖ Bom para √≠ndice:
   user_email: milh√µes de valores √∫nicos
   user_cpf: milh√µes de valores √∫nicos

   # ‚ùå Ruim para √≠ndice:
   is_active: apenas 2 valores (True/False)
   gender: apenas 3-4 valores
   ```

‚ùå **N√ÉO CRIE √≠ndices** quando:

1. **Tabela pequena** (< 1000 registros)
   - Table scan √© r√°pido o suficiente
   - Overhead do √≠ndice n√£o compensa

2. **Colunas atualizadas frequentemente**
   - Cada UPDATE precisa atualizar o √≠ndice
   - Pode ficar mais lento que o ganho

3. **Baixa cardinalidade** (poucos valores √∫nicos)
   ```python
   # ‚ùå N√ÉO indexe:
   is_deleted: Mapped[bool]  # Apenas True/False
   ticket_priority: Mapped[Priority]  # Apenas 4 valores
   ```

4. **Colunas raramente usadas**
   - Se nunca filtra por essa coluna, n√£o precisa

### Como Decidir: A Matriz de Decis√£o

```
                    Alta Cardinalidade    Baixa Cardinalidade
                    (muitos valores)      (poucos valores)

Filtrado            ‚úÖ CRIE √çNDICE        ü§î Depende
Frequentemente      Exemplo: email        Se > 10% dos dados
                                         n√£o vale a pena

Filtrado            ü§î Considere          ‚ùå N√ÉO CRIE
Raramente           Se query √© cr√≠tica    Overhead n√£o
                                         compensa

Nunca               ‚ùå N√ÉO CRIE          ‚ùå N√ÉO CRIE

```

### Criando √çndices

```python
from sqlalchemy import Index

class Ticket(Base):
    __tablename__ = "tickets"

    id: Mapped[int] = mapped_column(Integer, primary_key=True)
    ticket_title: Mapped[str] = mapped_column(String(200), index=True)  # √çndice simples
    ticket_status: Mapped[TicketStatus] = mapped_column(Enum(TicketStatus))
    created_at: Mapped[datetime] = mapped_column(DateTime(timezone=True))

    # √çndice composto
    __table_args__ = (
        Index("ix_ticket_status_created", "ticket_status", "created_at"),
    )
```

### Quando Criar √çndices

‚úÖ **Crie √≠ndices** em colunas que:
- S√£o usadas em `WHERE` frequentemente
- S√£o usadas em `JOIN` (FKs geralmente j√° t√™m)
- S√£o usadas em `ORDER BY`
- T√™m alta cardinalidade (muitos valores √∫nicos)

‚ùå **N√£o crie √≠ndices** em colunas que:
- S√£o atualizadas muito frequentemente
- T√™m baixa cardinalidade (ex: boolean)
- Raramente s√£o filtradas

### Analyze Query Performance

```python
# Ver plano de execu√ß√£o (PostgreSQL)

```

## 5.2 Padr√µes de Nomenclatura üìã ESSENCIAL

### Por Que Nomenclatura Importa?

**C√≥digo √© lido 10x mais vezes do que √© escrito.** Nomes ruins tornam o c√≥digo imposs√≠vel de entender e manter.

```python
# ‚ùå Nomes ruins:
class U(Base):
    __tablename__ = "u"
    i: Mapped[int] = mapped_column(primary_key=True)
    n: Mapped[str] = mapped_column()
    tid: Mapped[int] = mapped_column(ForeignKey("t.id"))

# ‚úÖ Nomes bons:
class User(Base):
    __tablename__ = "users"
    id: Mapped[int] = mapped_column(primary_key=True)
    user_full_name: Mapped[str] = mapped_column()
    user_team_id: Mapped[int] = mapped_column(ForeignKey("teams.id"))
```

**Qual voc√™ prefere ler/manter?**

### Princ√≠pios de Nomenclatura

1. **Clareza sobre Brevidade**
   - `user_full_name` > `name` > `n`
   - `ticket_created_at` > `created` > `ts`

2. **Consist√™ncia Absoluta**
   - Se usa `user_team_id`, use `ticket_client_id` (n√£o `ticket_clientId`)
   - Se usa `created_at`, use `updated_at` (n√£o `update_time`)

3. **Evite Abrevia√ß√µes**
   - `description` > `desc` (desc = descending?)
   - `quantity` > `qty`
   - `password` > `pwd`
   - **Exce√ß√£o**: Abrevia√ß√µes universais (id, url, api)

4. **Contexto no Nome**
   - Em `users` table: `user_email` (n√£o apenas `email`)
   - Em `tickets` table: `ticket_title` (n√£o apenas `title`)
   - **Por qu√™?**: Quando faz JOIN, fica claro de onde vem

### Conven√ß√µes por Tipo

### Tabelas e Colunas

```python
# Tabelas: plural, snake_case
__tablename__ = "users"
__tablename__ = "tickets"
__tablename__ = "user_tickets_association"

# Colunas: prefixo da tabela + nome, snake_case
user_full_name       # users.user_full_name
user_email           # users.user_email
ticket_title         # tickets.ticket_title
ticket_description   # tickets.ticket_description

# FKs: singular + _id
user_team_id         # FK para teams.id
ticket_client_id     # FK para users.id
```

### Models e Relationships

```python
# Models: singular, PascalCase
class User(Base): ...
class Team(Base): ...
class Ticket(Base): ...

# Relationships N-1: singular (retorna 1 objeto)
team: Mapped["Team"] = relationship(...)

# Relationships 1-N: plural (retorna lista)
team_members: Mapped[list["User"]] = relationship(...)
tickets: Mapped[list["Ticket"]] = relationship(...)

# Relationships N-N: plural com contexto
tickets_att: Mapped[list["Ticket"]] = relationship(...)  # Tickets atendidos
tickets_follow: Mapped[list["Ticket"]] = relationship(...)  # Tickets seguidos
```

### Schemas

```python

UserList          # Listagem

UserCreate        # Cria√ß√£o

TeamSimple        # Simplificado (evitar recurs√£o)
```

### Services e Repositories

## 5.3 Seguran√ßa e Valida√ß√£o ‚ö†Ô∏è CR√çTICO

### Por Que Seguran√ßa √â Cr√≠tica?

**Uma falha de seguran√ßa pode**:
- ‚ùå Expor dados sens√≠veis de clientes
- ‚ùå Resultar em multas de LGPD/GDPR
- ‚ùå Destruir reputa√ß√£o da empresa
- ‚ùå Causar preju√≠zos financeiros
- ‚ùå Levar a processos judiciais

**Seguran√ßa n√£o √© opcional. √â obrigat√≥ria.**

### As 3 Camadas de Seguran√ßa

```
‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
‚îÇ Camada 1: Valida√ß√£o de Entrada     ‚îÇ  ‚Üê Pydantic
‚îÇ (Garante que dados s√£o v√°lidos)    ‚îÇ
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î§
‚îÇ Camada 2: Sanitiza√ß√£o              ‚îÇ  ‚Üê SQLAlchemy
‚îÇ (Previne SQL Injection)            ‚îÇ
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î§
‚îÇ Camada 3: Autentica√ß√£o/Autoriza√ß√£o ‚îÇ  ‚Üê Hash, JWT
‚îÇ (Garante que usu√°rio pode acessar) ‚îÇ
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
```

Todas as 3 camadas s√£o necess√°rias.

### Top 5 Vulnerabilidades em APIs

```
1. SQL Injection          ‚Üê Atacante executa SQL malicioso
2. Broken Authentication  ‚Üê Senhas fracas, sem hash
3. Sensitive Data Exposure‚Üê Retornar senha/token na API
4. Mass Assignment        ‚Üê Cliente muda campos protegidos
5. Lack of Rate Limiting  ‚Üê DoS via requisi√ß√µes infinitas
```

Este tutorial foca nas 3 primeiras (escopo do ORM).

### Valida√ß√£o de Entrada: A Primeira Linha de Defesa

**Princ√≠pio**: NUNCA confie em dados vindos do cliente.

```python
# ‚ùå VULNER√ÅVEL:
```
